title: Spell Book Pt 2 (Bucky X Witch!Reader) *PLATONIC
body:
Character: Bucky X Witch!Reader, Bucky x Wanda

Universe: Marvel, Avengers

Warnings: Civil War Spoilers

Request: Hey ! Could you do a second part to “Spell Book” ? ‘Cause I really loved it !! Like the reader is trying to make Wanda and Bucky falling in love with each other because she ship them ?

It had been a few weeks since your visit to the Marvel Universe and the whole thing still gave you a kick. You did that. You travelled to a different universe and helped superheroes. You were definitely getting a lot better, and with the next movies making their appearances, Infinity War starting to approach, you decided to pay a visit- not because of a fight, but more of to just say hello.

However, this time you didn’t have an exact reason for wanting to go, and therefore the spell refused to work, so you just started muttering random desires you would like to do at the wall in Latin, pushing, and hoping to not literally hit a brick wall.

Stealing the Shield didn’t work.

Neither did getting knighted as an Avenger… to be fair, Tony probably wouldn’t knight you after your run in. So you decided to try something stupid.

“I want to get Bucky and Wanda together.” You admitted to the wall in your attic, and pushed, nearly tumbling forward as the wall disappeared. You squeezed your eyes shut, practically tripping all the way through the portal till you reached the other side, and falling over. “I can’t believe that worked out of all the requests…” You muttered, getting up and dusting your knees off, until you heard something… turning on… probably a weapon… turning your head to the side and looking up, you saw Shuri pointing one of her gauntlets at you, and you realised where you were.

“Who are you, and how did you do that?” She asked you, nodding her head to the now bare wall. You raised your hands in surrender.

“Okay… I’m a witch and Steve and Bucky know me. I helped them escape.” You explained quickly. The names of the superheroes made her back away a little, giving you a little space.

“You are to stay there with your hands were I can see them while I call my brother.” She ordered, rushing over to her desk. It wasn’t long till the Dora Milaje came rushing down with T’Challa. He of course recognised you as the kid who was at the airport who disappeared with Bucky and Steve, and he gestured to his side. The Dora Milaje parted, and Steve came though, surprised to see you, and you gave a cheeky smile.

“Hey Steve.” You greeted. Steve looked back at the king, before looking back at you, motioning you to stand up. You did as told, and he took your arm, guiding you away. “Sorry for causing a bit of a scene, but I don’t really have control over where the spell decides to drop me.” You apologised to him, surprised at the little chuckle you got from him in response.

“Don’t worry kid. I’m just glad you’re okay. I think Bucky will be to when he sees you. After you paralysed Tony you vanished and Tony said you went through some sort of panel, and we didn’t know what happened to you after that.” He explained. It was understandable they’d be worried about you- you helped them without them actually knowing you and then disappeared. You knew you should have explained to them better that you’d have to go home at some point, and paralysing Tony and then disappearing before he could actually kick your skull in was your plan.

“There wasn’t really much I could have helped with past that point and… I had school the next day.” You admitted, which only made him chuckle more. “…Was everything okay after I left?” You asked. You worried that you’d messed up their universe too much and you’d actually damaged beyond repair, but that thought was always pushed to the side. But now if you had messed up, you were about to face the music.

“Actually… things are pretty good. Tony’s doesn’t contact us a lot, but Rhodey somehow didn’t lose his ability to walk… guess that has something to do with you?” Your proud smile answered his question. “And things are pretty calm now… but with you here I’m guessing you’ve come to warn us or something?” He asked.

“Actually no. It’s summer break and one of the big movies is coming up and… I just wanted to say hi really. Check how you guys are… How’s Wanda?” You asked, remembering the request of the spell, knowing the spell won’t work till it was accomplished… and you were starting to realise how big a task it actually was.

“She’s fine… Her and Vision aren’t seeing each other anymore, it wasn’t working but they’re friends still. She’s settled in pretty well here with me, Buck and Nat.” He told you, and he saw the smile on your face. “Okay, why are you really here?” He asked, stopping you in the hallway.

“Okay… well I did want to check on you guys and to just say hello, but since the spell doesn’t work without a proper reason, I was just saying stuff and now it probably won’t let me back till I complete said task and- I may have set the task to get Bucky and Wanda together.” You explained quickly to him, seeing the shock set in his face, and then turn into pleasant humour.

“Well… I’ve gotten you a head start- I’ve been busy trying to patch things up with Tony and Nat’s been coming along, so they’ve been alone for a lot and have been getting on pretty well.” He told you.

Steve led you out the building and through the bustling city while you caught up on anything you missed out on between movies as you headed to a more desolate location till you could see a small home, and a familiar man working outside it, conversing with another familiar face. Both soon heard you approaching, and turned to see you, looking surprised at the appearance of you.

“Y/N? What are you doing here?” Wanda asked.

“Just came to say hi and to let you guys know I’m okay and to make sure you’re doing okay… don’t worry, I haven’t come to warn you about something… yet.” You assured her, offering a hug that she accepted, before turning to Bucky, who seemed genuinely happy to see you, with a smile and a hug as a greeting.

“I’m glad you’re okay kid. I owe you for helping me.” Bucky told you, keeping his hand on your shoulder. You shrugged him off.

“I wanted to help, don’t worry about it Buck.” You assured. “Anyway, is this where you live now?” You asked, peeking behind him at the hut. He nodded, motioning you to follow him, leaving Wanda and Steve behind. Perfect. He led you into the hut, showing you the interior. “So… making friends?” You asked him.

“Yeah. T’Challa ain’t trying to kill me anymore, as you can tell since he’s given me residency and protection. Nat and I have been getting a long- she’s been kind of a spokesperson for me when talking to Tony since I can’t be in a room with him yet without him trying to kill me… and Wanda and I are getting a long pretty well.” He informed you, and you smirked. “What?”

“Pretty well you say?” You hinted. You turned to look at you with a small grin on his face, before turning around again, but you saw that toothy smile. “You like her?” You asked, inching closer. He nudged you, but you only gasped and got closer. “You so like her!”

“Shush, she’ll hear you!” Bucky shushed you, but he couldn’t get rid of that grin on his face. “And anyway, what does it matter?” He asked. You smirked, going in your bag and pulling out the infamous book, flicking through the pages.

“Here’s the spell to get here. I need a reason to want to travel universes, and it just so happened that the spell allowed ‘getting Bucky and Wanda together’ as a reason. So, looks like I’m playing cupid.” You smirked, seeing the horror rise in his face.

“Y/N, you better not do any love spells-“

“Ew, no! I checked and double checked the rules of this spell and while I can do spells to influence things, I can’t do spells to ‘cheat’, aka force love. However… I can use a harmless spell that lets me get her mind’s opinion on one thing. She won’t even know what’s happening. I can see if she likes you back… and if she does, then you have to ask her out, okay?” You bargained with him.

“Steve won’t like this.” Bucky said.

“Steve also wants you to get together, he does like this.” That caused a groan from him and a laugh from you as you started skimming the book for that spell.

Hope you like it! If you have any questions, please send them in! 

*Not my gif

“Don’t worry kid. I’m just glad you’re okay. I think Bucky will be to when he sees you. After you paralysed Tony you vanished and Tony said you went through some sort of panel, and we didn’t know what happened to you after that.” He explained. It was understandable they’d be worried about you- you helped them without them actually knowing you and then disappeared. You knew you should have explained to them better that you’d have to go home at some point, and paralysing Tony and then disappearing before he could actually kick your skull in was your plan.

“There wasn’t really much I could have helped with past that point and… I had school the next day.” You admitted, which only made him chuckle more. “…Was everything okay after I left?” You asked. You worried that you’d messed up their universe too much and you’d actually damaged beyond repair, but that thought was always pushed to the side. But now if you had messed up, you were about to face the music.

“Actually… things are pretty good. Tony’s doesn’t contact us a lot, but Rhodey somehow didn’t lose his ability to walk… guess that has something to do with you?” Your proud smile answered his question. “And things are pretty calm now… but with you here I’m guessing you’ve come to warn us or something?” He asked.

“Actually no. It’s summer break and one of the big movies is coming up and… I just wanted to say hi really. Check how you guys are… How’s Wanda?” You asked, remembering the request of the spell, knowing the spell won’t work till it was accomplished… and you were starting to realise how big a task it actually was.

“She’s fine… Her and Vision aren’t seeing each other anymore, it wasn’t working but they’re friends still. She’s settled in pretty well here with me, Buck and Nat.” He told you, and he saw the smile on your face. “Okay, why are you really here?” He asked, stopping you in the hallway.

“Okay… well I did want to check on you guys and to just say hello, but since the spell doesn’t work without a proper reason, I was just saying stuff and now it probably won’t let me back till I complete said task and- I may have set the task to get Bucky and Wanda together.” You explained quickly to him, seeing the shock set in his face, and then turn into pleasant humour.

“Well… I’ve gotten you a head start- I’ve been busy trying to patch things up with Tony and Nat’s been coming along, so they’ve been alone for a lot and have been getting on pretty well.” He told you.

Steve led you out the building and through the bustling city while you caught up on anything you missed out on between movies as you headed to a more desolate location till you could see a small home, and a familiar man working outside it, conversing with another familiar face. Both soon heard you approaching, and turned to see you, looking surprised at the appearance of you.

“Y/N? What are you doing here?” Wanda asked.

“Just came to say hi and to let you guys know I’m okay and to make sure you’re doing okay… don’t worry, I haven’t come to warn you about something… yet.” You assured her, offering a hug that she accepted, before turning to Bucky, who seemed genuinely happy to see you, with a smile and a hug as a greeting.

“I’m glad you’re okay kid. I owe you for helping me.” Bucky told you, keeping his hand on your shoulder. You shrugged him off.

“I wanted to help, don’t worry about it Buck.” You assured. “Anyway, is this where you live now?” You asked, peeking behind him at the hut. He nodded, motioning you to follow him, leaving Wanda and Steve behind. Perfect. He led you into the hut, showing you the interior. “So… making friends?” You asked him.

“Yeah. T’Challa ain’t trying to kill me anymore, as you can tell since he’s given me residency and protection. Nat and I have been getting a long- she’s been kind of a spokesperson for me when talking to Tony since I can’t be in a room with him yet without him trying to kill me… and Wanda and I are getting a long pretty well.” He informed you, and you smirked. “What?”

“Pretty well you say?” You hinted. You turned to look at you with a small grin on his face, before turning around again, but you saw that toothy smile. “You like her?” You asked, inching closer. He nudged you, but you only gasped and got closer. “You so like her!”

“Shush, she’ll hear you!” Bucky shushed you, but he couldn’t get rid of that grin on his face. “And anyway, what does it matter?” He asked. You smirked, going in your bag and pulling out the infamous book, flicking through the pages.

“Here’s the spell to get here. I need a reason to want to travel universes, and it just so happened that the spell allowed ‘getting Bucky and Wanda together’ as a reason. So, looks like I’m playing cupid.” You smirked, seeing the horror rise in his face.

“Y/N, you better not do any love spells-“

“Ew, no! I checked and double checked the rules of this spell and while I can do spells to influence things, I can’t do spells to ‘cheat’, aka force love. However… I can use a harmless spell that lets me get her mind’s opinion on one thing. She won’t even know what’s happening. I can see if she likes you back… and if she does, then you have to ask her out, okay?” You bargained with him.

“Steve won’t like this.” Bucky said.

“Steve also wants you to get together, he does like this.” That caused a groan from him and a laugh from you as you started skimming the book for that spell.

Hope you like it! If you have any questions, please send them in! 

*Not my gif

Character: Bucky X Witch!Reader, Bucky x Wanda

Universe: Marvel, Avengers

Warnings: Civil War Spoilers

Request: Hey ! Could you do a second part to “Spell Book” ? ‘Cause I really loved it !! Like the reader is trying to make Wanda and Bucky falling in love with each other because she ship them ?

It had been a few weeks since your visit to the Marvel Universe and the whole thing still gave you a kick. You did that. You travelled to a different universe and helped superheroes. You were definitely getting a lot better, and with the next movies making their appearances, Infinity War starting to approach, you decided to pay a visit- not because of a fight, but more of to just say hello.

tags: I’M A FILM MAKER OK I GET IT.
I legit predicted that Loki would die within the first 10 minutes of IW coz it just makes that much sense from a filmmaker’s perspective.
summary: Why Loki’s Death in Infinity War was justified.
body:
Why Loki’s Death in Infinity War was justified.

Just hear me out. Literally the only reason it makes sense was because he’s such an interesting and compelling character. Did I want him dead? No. I think Loki’s one of the best characters in the MCU, but I understand why he died.

  • In universe: Loki let Thanos down by losing 2 Infinity Stones to Earth in the first Avengers movie. Thanos was never going to let that go. Come on.
  • Loki had completed his journey and then some. His arc was completed in The Dark World, and then in Ragnarok he got to continue and actually live his dream of ruling Asgard (and then intended to do it again on Sakaar, showing that Loki is stuck in his own cycle, even though his “redemption” was completed in the previous movie). It was shown that although he longed to rule, he wasn’t particularly suited for it and therefore added more justification to the fact that Thor/The Avengers kept stopping him from reaching that power. Even after proving that he isn’t fit to rule and is much more suited as a luxurious [slutty] right - hand - man to whoever actually is in charge, he still acts as though he is the saviour of the Sakaar and Asgardian refugees, although we know that Thor will eventually be the king once the immediate battle is over. Basically Ragnarok just proves that Loki is forever stuck in his own cycle of bad decisions for selfish reasons, but that he isn’t truly evil. He’s just the God of Mischief. He’s got the mischief part down, but without being a king, he’s somewhat lost on the whole “god” part, and will forever be trying to find it.
  • Loki dying in Infinity War reiterates what Ragnarok confirmed and what has always been hinted at throughout all of his appearances in the MCU - that Loki is not evil. Now that Thor has accepted his place as King of Asgard, and that they are returning to Earth, where Loki is surely not welcome, if Loki were to continue in the series, he wouldn’t really have anywhere to go as a character. They’d have to start a new arc with him, which is fine, but when the last arc took 3 Thor films and 2 Avengers films to complete, I just don’t see Marvel committing to that new arc for who knows how many future movies. Loki dying in Infinity War completed his personal 5 movie arc in a valiant way and I think that it’s what Loki deserved - to die on the side of good, next to his brother Thor, but his death comes as a repercussion of his past crimes (the Battle of New York and losing the Infinity Stones).
  • Loki’s death in Infinity War isn’t the sole reason for Thor’s journey in that movie. Thor is doing what he’s doing because it’s what he has to do, it’s the RIGHT thing to do, and he is a hero and a king. Thor just lost his father, had to kill his sister whom he only just learnt existed at all, his homeland was entirely destroyed, half of his people murdered, one of his longest and best friends murdered (Heimdall), and then finally, Loki is killed. Sure Loki’s death helps propel Thor’s story a bit, but it serves more as a reminder of all that Thor’s been through, rather than an inciting incident for Thor’s decision to go after Thanos. Not Fridging. Not purely to propel Thor forward. We don’t mourn Loki because Thor’s mourning him, we mourn him because it’s Loki. Loki’s death is his own.
  • Finally, Loki dying in the first 10 minutes doesn’t really serve as a propeller for the plot or any singular character’s journey within that movie, but more as a demonstration. Mostly, a demonstration as to what’s to come. A demonstration of Thanos’s ruthlessness and power. A demonstration that no character, regardless of how compelling or powerful they may be, is safe in this film.

In Infinity War, we morn for Loki’s death not because of what it means for Thor specifically, but because of what it means for the AUDIENCE to lose Loki. THAT is why it is as truly tragic as it is, and that is why Loki’s death makes sense in Infinity War.

summary: The Nice Guy - Clint Barton X Reader college!AU - 1/6
title: The Nice Guy - Clint Barton X Reader college!AU - 1/6
body:
I don’t remember if it was @rogue-barnes-16 or @cryforfandoms who inspired this, but it was one of them. Plus, I’m having so much fun writing Clint in NCNR, and also I’m sick of the trope of unrequited love actually being requited. (You’ll find out as you read it.) So, here you go. My first Clint Barton fic.

EDIT: I apparently accidentally removed the “keep reading” before posting. Sorry to everyone who found that before I fixed it.

Word count: 1453

Warnings: Mild angst. A tiny bit of commentary on my opinion of the traditional idea of masculinity. 

The small party was in full swing when you arrived at Clint and Natasha’s new place. They had used Christmas break to move into their off-campus apartment and had invited your core friend group over for a New Year’s Eve bash.

The three of you had grown up together, and although your friend group had expanded once you were in college, you were still each other’s best friends. They had invited you to join them when the apartment hunt had started, but you’d just been upgraded to a solo apartment at your residence hall and were looking forward to not having roommates for once in your life.

“Hey, there she is!” Sam called out as you entered. “Riley! Your girl’s here!”

Your boyfriend, Sam’s roommate Riley, emerged from around the corner.

“Hey baby,” he greeted you, leaning in to give you a kiss and taking the grocery bags from your hand. “What did you bring?”

“Three bags each of nacho cheese and cool ranch Doritos for us normal people,” you grinned, pulling out a yellow bag. “And, of course, one bag of plain Doritos for the weirdo.”

“I heard that,” Clint said, swooping in from somewhere to grab them from you. “I’d be mad, but I’ve been seriously craving nachos all day. Thanks, Y/N.” He shoved a few dollar bills in your hand and bolted for the kitchen.

“Y/N, can you make sure he doesn’t light our new microwave on fire?” Nat called to you from living room. “He forgot to take the plastic off one of them last time.”

You winced and called back your agreement, giving Riley a peck on the cheek before following Clint.

“I can’t believe you can actually crave nachos with a recipe like that,” you teased Clint as you entered the kitchen.

He looked up at you from where he was peeling the plastic off squares of American cheese. “Says the lactose intolerant chic who wouldn’t know good nachos if they did the salsa in front of her. I don’t know how you stand that vegan cheese stuff.”

“At least I’m not dropping sandwich squares of cheap cheese on a plate of boring chips,” you shot back. “Have you ever considered, I don’t know, adding something with flavor? Taco meat, or salsa, or something? Heck, even flavored Doritos would make that stuff better.”

Clint dropped his plate in the microwave and shook his head. “There’s nothing wrong with simple. Besides, I’m in college; I’m taking advantage of the expectation I won’t know how to cook. I have to learn enough stuff in class already, so no way am I trying to cram more kitchen info into my brain when I can survive just fine on this stuff.”

You sighed and shook your head. “You’re hopeless, Barton, you know that?”

“And you love me anyway,” he grinned, dropping an arm around your shoulders.

“Whatever lets you sleep at night,” you laughed, shrugging off his shoulder and wandering back out to the party.

Clint watched you leave and sighed. Having you and your boyfriend hanging off each other in his apartment was going to test his self-control all night. This was going to be a long party.

———- 

You settled in next to Nat, who was curled up in her boyfriend Bucky’s lap. He was talking to Sam and Riley, leaving her free to converse with you.

“How are you two enjoying the new apartment so far?”

“It’s so nice being off-campus,” she admitted. “Clint’s a great roommate, too, when he’s not melting plastic in the microwave. Are you enjoying living alone?”

“Gosh, yes,” you sighed, “it’s perfect. No one leaves dishes in the sink overnight or their coat on the couch.”

She laughed and shook her head. “You always were a bit of a neat freak.”

“Hey, Nat?” Bucky shot you a look of apology as he cut into your conversation. “Can I get up, doll? I’d like to go with the guys who are picking up some pizza.”

Nat pouted at him, but you could see the smile she was trying to hide. “But I’m comfy,” she whined.

“If all the guys all go, we’ll get a few minutes of girl time,” you offered.

Bucky gave you a grateful smile when Natasha sighed and stood up. He, Sam, and Riley gathered their coats as Steve came up with his car keys.

“Hey, Barton, wanna join us?” Sam called. “We’re gonna go get pizzas and drinks. The girls are staying here to do who knows what girly stuff. We’ve got one more seat in the car.”

“Nah,” Clint said as he came around the corner, nachos in hand. “I’m gonna stay and finish these.”

“He’s practically one of the girls anyway,” Nat teased. “It can still be a girl’s night.”

Riley leaned over and kissed you on the cheek. “We’ll be back in an hour, baby.”

“All right,” you smiled up at him, “see you then.”

———– 

“What the hell?”

At Sam’s exclamation, the three of you looked up at the guys who had just tromped in with the pizzas and a few cases of soda.

“What?” Clint asked innocently.

You and Natasha were seated on the floor facing each other, painting each other’s toenails. Clint’s were already finished; he was leaning his back against the couch and reading an article from the latest issue of Us Weekly aloud as they dried.

Sam gave his feet a pointed look. “Your toenails are hot pink.”

“The color,” Clint informed him, “is called Bachelorette Bash. Nat’s are Russian Roulette and Y/N’s are Loot the Booty.”

Riley made a choking sound. You shot him a glare.

“Pirate booty, Babe. Treasure. Get your mind out of the gutter.”

“Man,” Sam shook his head, “you’re crazy.”

“Told you he was practically one of us,” Nat laughed.

You grinned up at your boyfriend. “I’d be happy to do yours next.”

“I think I’ll pass,” he said with a smile, bending over to kiss you on the top of your head. “Maybe Sam’ll take you up on the offer.”

“Like hell I will,” Sam muttered, drawing a laugh from his roommate.

“I’ll take mine in mint green,” Bucky announced, flopping down on the couch.

Nat blew on your toes as she finished the last one and reached for a bottle of base coat. “Do you mean Chillato, Mint Candy Apple, or Bon Boy-age?”

“The first one.”

“Dibs on…” Steve scooped up a bottle and read the color title, “Leggy Legend.”

“Shoes and socks off,” you laughed as you took the bottle from him. “Do you want base and top coat too, or just the polish?”

He looked at you like you were crazy. “Duh, base and top coat too! Gotta help that color last as long as possible.”

Sam shot a look at Riley. “We’re surrounded by crazies.”

“It’s just polish,” Bucky scoffed. “It’s not like having colorful toenails puts your manhood in jeopardy.”

“You could learn a thing or two from us,” Clint said with a nod. “We have attractive women fussing over our feet.”

“If you’re concerned about people seeing the color, I have some nearly invisible sheer polish you’re welcome to use,” Nat informed them, finishing the basecoat on Bucky’s second foot. “It doesn’t even have a girly name.”

“Shine makes your nails look healthier,” Steve teased.

“I’m good, really,” Sam insisted with a shake of his head.

“Same,” Riley agreed.

The two of them passed around sodas and slices of pizza to those who were stuck in place while their toenails dried. By the time the ball dropped on TV, everyone’s polish was dry and people had resituated themselves around the room.

“You know, we’re in New York,” Steve remarked dryly. “We could’ve gone to see the ball drop in person.”

“Yes, but the apartment is warmer,” Clint pointed out.

“Touché.”

The singles in the room cheered as the ball dropped, while the two couples kissed.

“Happy New Year, Baby,” Riley whispered.

You smiled back. “Happy New Year.”

———- 

Well, that could have gone worse, Clint told himself as he lay in bed, the party long over. He’d gotten an hour with you and Natasha without Riley around kissing you every few minutes. He’d had to glue his eyes to the TV for your New Year’s kiss, but as hard as it had been to see you happy with someone else, he did like to see you happy. Maybe if he hadn’t been a coward through high school, you’d be happy with him instead.

He rolled over and curled himself around his extra pillow. As he slept, thoughts of you kept drifting through his head. Your smile, your laugh, the way you lit up at his stupid jokes….

Yeah, he definitely had it bad.
body_abstract:
I don’t remember if it was @rogue-barnes-16 or @cryforfandoms who inspired this, but it was one of them. Plus, I’m having so much fun writing Clint in NCNR, and also I’m sick of the trope of unrequited love actually being requited. (You’ll find out as you read it.) So, here you go. My first Clint Barton fic.

EDIT: I apparently accidentally removed the “keep reading” before posting. Sorry to everyone who found that before I fixed it.

Word count: 1453

Warnings: Mild angst. A tiny bit of commentary on my opinion of the traditional idea of masculinity. 

The small party was in full swing when you arrived at Clint and Natasha’s new place. They had used Christmas break to move into their off-campus apartment and had invited your core friend group over for a New Year’s Eve bash.

The three of you had grown up together, and although your friend group had expanded once you were in college, you were still each other’s best friends. They had invited you to join them when the apartment hunt had started, but you’d just been upgraded to a solo apartment at your residence hall and were looking forward to not having roommates for once in your life.

Nat pouted at him, but you could see the smile she was trying to hide. “But I’m comfy,” she whined.

“If all the guys all go, we’ll get a few minutes of girl time,” you offered.

Bucky gave you a grateful smile when Natasha sighed and stood up. He, Sam, and Riley gathered their coats as Steve came up with his car keys.

“Hey, Barton, wanna join us?” Sam called. “We’re gonna go get pizzas and drinks. The girls are staying here to do who knows what girly stuff. We’ve got one more seat in the car.”

“Nah,” Clint said as he came around the corner, nachos in hand. “I’m gonna stay and finish these.”

“He’s practically one of the girls anyway,” Nat teased. “It can still be a girl’s night.”

Riley leaned over and kissed you on the cheek. “We’ll be back in an hour, baby.”

“All right,” you smiled up at him, “see you then.”

———– 

“What the hell?”

At Sam’s exclamation, the three of you looked up at the guys who had just tromped in with the pizzas and a few cases of soda.

“What?” Clint asked innocently.

You and Natasha were seated on the floor facing each other, painting each other’s toenails. Clint’s were already finished; he was leaning his back against the couch and reading an article from the latest issue of Us Weekly aloud as they dried.

Sam gave his feet a pointed look. “Your toenails are hot pink.”

“The color,” Clint informed him, “is called Bachelorette Bash. Nat’s are Russian Roulette and Y/N’s are Loot the Booty.”

Riley made a choking sound. You shot him a glare.

“Pirate booty, Babe. Treasure. Get your mind out of the gutter.”

“Man,” Sam shook his head, “you’re crazy.”

“Told you he was practically one of us,” Nat laughed.

You grinned up at your boyfriend. “I’d be happy to do yours next.”

“I think I’ll pass,” he said with a smile, bending over to kiss you on the top of your head. “Maybe Sam’ll take you up on the offer.”

“Like hell I will,” Sam muttered, drawing a laugh from his roommate.

“I’ll take mine in mint green,” Bucky announced, flopping down on the couch.

Nat blew on your toes as she finished the last one and reached for a bottle of base coat. “Do you mean Chillato, Mint Candy Apple, or Bon Boy-age?”

“The first one.”

“Dibs on…” Steve scooped up a bottle and read the color title, “Leggy Legend.”

“Shoes and socks off,” you laughed as you took the bottle from him. “Do you want base and top coat too, or just the polish?”

He looked at you like you were crazy. “Duh, base and top coat too! Gotta help that color last as long as possible.”

Sam shot a look at Riley. “We’re surrounded by crazies.”

“It’s just polish,” Bucky scoffed. “It’s not like having colorful toenails puts your manhood in jeopardy.”

“You could learn a thing or two from us,” Clint said with a nod. “We have attractive women fussing over our feet.”

“If you’re concerned about people seeing the color, I have some nearly invisible sheer polish you’re welcome to use,” Nat informed them, finishing the basecoat on Bucky’s second foot. “It doesn’t even have a girly name.”

“Shine makes your nails look healthier,” Steve teased.

“I’m good, really,” Sam insisted with a shake of his head.

“Same,” Riley agreed.

The two of them passed around sodas and slices of pizza to those who were stuck in place while their toenails dried. By the time the ball dropped on TV, everyone’s polish was dry and people had resituated themselves around the room.

“You know, we’re in New York,” Steve remarked dryly. “We could’ve gone to see the ball drop in person.”

“Yes, but the apartment is warmer,” Clint pointed out.

“Touché.”

The singles in the room cheered as the ball dropped, while the two couples kissed.

“Happy New Year, Baby,” Riley whispered.

You smiled back. “Happy New Year.”

———- 

Well, that could have gone worse, Clint told himself as he lay in bed, the party long over. He’d gotten an hour with you and Natasha without Riley around kissing you every few minutes. He’d had to glue his eyes to the TV for your New Year’s kiss, but as hard as it had been to see you happy with someone else, he did like to see you happy. Maybe if he hadn’t been a coward through high school, you’d be happy with him instead.

He rolled over and curled himself around his extra pillow. As he slept, thoughts of you kept drifting through his head. Your smile, your laugh, the way you lit up at his stupid jokes….

Yeah, he definitely had it bad.
trail.content_abstract:
I don’t remember if it was @rogue-barnes-16 or @cryforfandoms who inspired this, but it was one of them. Plus, I’m having so much fun writing Clint in NCNR, and also I’m sick of the trope of unrequited love actually being requited. (You’ll find out as you read it.) So, here you go. My first Clint Barton fic.

EDIT: I apparently accidentally removed the “keep reading” before posting. Sorry to everyone who found that before I fixed it.

Word count: 1453

Warnings: Mild angst. A tiny bit of commentary on my opinion of the traditional idea of masculinity. 

The small party was in full swing when you arrived at Clint and Natasha’s new place. They had used Christmas break to move into their off-campus apartment and had invited your core friend group over for a New Year’s Eve bash.

The three of you had grown up together, and although your friend group had expanded once you were in college, you were still each other’s best friends. They had invited you to join them when the apartment hunt had started, but you’d just been upgraded to a solo apartment at your residence hall and were looking forward to not having roommates for once in your life.
